background: A soda company distributes bottles to stores using a fleet of old and new vans, each with different capacities and pollution outputs.
constraints: Number of old vans used is non-negative
Number of new vans used is non-negative
At least MinBottles bottles must be delivered
At most MaxNewVans new vans can be used
objective: Minimize the total amount of pollution produced while meeting delivery requirements
description: A soda company sends bottles of their soda to stores around the city in old and new vans. An old van can take \param{OldVanCapacity} soda bottles while a new van can take \param{NewVanCapacity} soda bottles. An old van produces \param{OldVanPollution} units of pollution while a new van only produces \param{NewVanPollution} units of pollution. The company needs to send at least \param{MinBottles} bottles. In addition, at most \param{MaxNewVans} new vans can be used. How many of each van should be used to minimize the total amount of pollution produced?

parameters.definition: Pollution produced by an old van
Pollution produced by a new van
Minimum quantity of soda bottles to be sent
Maximum number of new vans allowed
